generated_answer: Basal cell carcinoma is most commonly found on the head and neck, particularly on the face and ears. It can also occur on the trunk, arms, and legs.

evidence: Fair skin increases the risk of BCC.
generated_answer: Fair skin can increase the risk of developing Basal Cell Carcinoma (BCC) due to its reduced ability to produce melanin, which acts as a natural sunscreen. This vulnerability to UV radiation from the sun can lead to skin damage and potentially cancerous growths.
ground_truth: Fair skin increases the risk of BCC.
